Peaceful Revolution: If all humans suddenly became pacifists, it could lead to a peaceful revolution where people would work towards creating a society that is non-violent and conflict-free. This could involve peaceful protests, strikes, and other forms of civil disobedience to bring about change.

End of Wars: With the majority of the population becoming pacifists, it is possible that wars could come to an end. This could be due to a lack of support for military actions, as well as a shift in values towards peace and cooperation.
Economic Boost: A world without war would mean less spending on military and more on social programs, leading to an economic boost in many countries.

Change in Power Structures: If all humans became pacifists, it could lead to a shift in power structures, with non-violent means of conflict resolution becoming more prevalent. This could lead to a more just and equitable society.
Global Unity: With a shared belief in peace and non-violence, it could bring global unity and cooperation, leading to a more harmonious and peaceful world.
